case_title: WILLIAM DE NORONHA and others vs ASSISTANT COMMISSIONER OF INCOME-TAX and others
reference_no_or_id: Civil Miscellaneous Writ Petition No.1020 of 1996
case_number: Civil Miscellaneous Writ Petition No. 1020 of 1996
respondant: Assistant Commissioner of Income-Tax and others
respondents: ASSISTANT COMMISSIONER OF INCOME-TAX and others

accussed_details.name: Terrance De Noronha
allegation: Improper valuation of properties under Wealth Tax Act and Income Tax Act

complaint_summary: Petitioners sought quashing of the valuation reference made for properties Nos. 17/9 and 17/9-A, the Mall, Kanpur, under sections 16-A of the Wealth Tax Act and 55-A of the Income Tax Act.
investigation_summary: Respondents argued that the valuation reference was made to determine capital gains liability and deemed gift liability under relevant statutes, asserting legality of the proceedings.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the petition, holding that the valuation reference was valid under sections 16-A of the Wealth Tax Act and 55-A of the Income Tax Act. The petitioners' arguments were deemed misconceived.
Decision_or_verdict: Petition dismissed; stay order dated October 17, 1995, vacated.
legal_arguments: Petitioners argued valuation proceedings were contrary to section 16-A of the Wealth Tax Act.
Respondents contended valuation reference was valid under sections 16-A of the Wealth Tax Act and 55-A of the Income Tax Act to determine liabilities.

key_arguments.petitioners: Valuation of properties under orders dated February 2, 1995, and July 10, 1995, is contrary to Section 16-A of the Wealth Tax Act as no assessment or reassessment proceedings were pending.
key_arguments.respondents: Valuation reference is valid under Section 16-A of the Wealth Tax Act and Section 55-A of the Income Tax Act due to pending proceedings against one of the partners under Section 148 of the Income Tax Act.

assets: Properties Nos. 17/9 and 17/9-A, the Mall, Kanpur
sections: 45 read with Section 9(1)(i) of Income Tax Act
citations: Laxmi Devi Jain v. WTO (1992) 193 ITR 154 (All.)

court_findings.validity_of_reference: The reference for valuation under Section 16-A of the Wealth Tax Act and Section 55-A of the Income Tax Act is legal and valid.
court_findings.applicability_of_precedents: Cited cases (V.K. Jain v. WTO and Laxmi Devi Jain v. WTO) are not applicable to the facts of this case.

final_decision: Petition dismissed. Stay order dated October 17, 1995, vacated.
key_issues: Validity of valuation reference under section 16-A of Wealth Tax Act.
Applicability of section 55-A of Income Tax Act for property valuation.

legal_terms.Valuation Reference: A process to determine the fair market value of assets for tax purposes.

words_and_phrases.Fair Market Value: The price at which an asset would trade in a competitive auction setting.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved a dispute over the legality of property valuation references under tax statutes. The court upheld the validity of the references, dismissing the petitioners' claims as misconceived.
